Example on GitHub

This is a example of how to push a comand on GitHub.

How to git push and commit

  1. Firstly, when I am in the correct folder, I type git status.
    2. git status
  2. This shows the red files which are not commited, and the green files which are.
    3. git add .
  3. This adds all the files to the commit
    4. git commit -m "Your message "
  4. This adds a little message to the commit
    5. git push
  5. This pushes the files up to the branch.

Extra resources

Link Wiki Link CodeCademy Link tutorial

GitHub is a code hosting platform for version control and collaboration. It lets you and others work together on projects from anywhere.
